claim.description: The name of the claim being mapped. This value must be provided when creating or modifying an attribute mapping.

id.description: The UUID of the OIDC identity provider attribute mapping.

oidcIdentityProviderId.description: The UUID of the OIDC identity provider the attribute mapping belongs to.

userAttributeId.description: The UUID of the IDaaS user attribute being mapped to. This value must be provided when creating or modifying an attribute mapping.

OidcIdentityProviderAttributeMapping.description: An OidcIdentityProviderAttributeMapping maps a claim returned from an external OIDC identity provider user authentication or user verification to an IDaaS user attribute.

acrValues.description: The space separated list of authentication context request values to request as part of the external OIDC identity provider user authentication or user verification request.

amrValues.description: The space separated list of authentication method request values to request as part of the external OIDC identity provider user authentication or user verification request. This is required when creating an IDV IDP.

authenticationEnabled.description: A flag indicating if the external OIDC identity provider can be used for user authentication. If enabled, userAttributeId and userClaim are required.

authorizationEndpoint.description: The authorization endpoint for the external OIDC identity provider. This value is required when creating an IDP.

buttonImage.description: The URI of the logo to display on the login button for this external OIDC identity provider.

buttonText.description: The unique text to display on the login button for this external OIDC identity provider. This value is required when creating an IDP.

clientAuthenticationMethod.description: The client authentication method to use with the external OIDC identity provider. The default value is ClientAuthenticationMethod.CLIENT_SECRET_BASIC.

clientId.description: The client identifier provided by the external OIDC identity provider. This value is required when creating an IDP.

clientSecret.description: The client secret provided by the external OIDC identity provider. This value is required when creating an IDP.

createUser.description: A flag indicating if the user should be created after authenticating to the external OIDC identity provider if it doesn't exist. The user attributes specified by the userAttributeMappings attribute are used to populate the user in IDaaS. This value can only be set if authenticationEnabled is true.

domains.description: The space separated list of domains associated with the external OIDC identity provider for use with user authentication.

fields.description: The value of user fields that need to be set the external OIDC identity provider when acquiring user information. This value is required when creating a TWITTER IDP.

groupIds.description: The UUIDs of groups that will be assigned to users created after an external OIDC identity provider user authentication. An empty list means the user will be assigned to All Groups. If configured, the full set of groups must be configured. This value can only be set if createUser is true.

items.description: The UUIDs of groups that will be assigned to users created after an external OIDC identity provider user authentication. An empty list means the user will be assigned to All Groups. If configured, the full set of groups must be configured. This value can only be set if createUser is true.

groupMapping.description: The association between a specified claim returned from the external OIDC identity provider and IDaaS groups. This mapping is used to associated IDaaS groups when a user is created or modified based on an external OIDC identity provider user authentication or when it is modified based on an external OIDC identity provider user verification. This value can only be set if createUser, updateUser, or updateVerificationUser is true.

idTokenClaims.description: The space separated list of id token claims to request as part of the external OIDC identity provider user authentication or user verification request.

issuer.description: The issuer URI for the external OIDC identity provider. This value is required when creating an IDP.

jwksUri.description: The JWKS URI endpoint for the external OIDC identity provider used to verify a token signature. This value is required when creating an IDP except for TWITTER.

maxAge.description: The max age to request as part of the external OIDC identity provider user authentication or user verification request. If -1, the value will not be included in the request.

name.description: The unique name of the external OIDC identity provider. This value is required when creating an IDP.

organizationIds.description: The UUIDs of organizations that will be assigned to users created after an external OIDC identity provider user authentication. If configured, the full set of organizations must be configured. This value can only be set if createUser is true.

items.description: The UUIDs of organizations that will be assigned to users created after an external OIDC identity provider user authentication. If configured, the full set of organizations must be configured. This value can only be set if createUser is true.

requireUserinfoSignature.description: A flag indicating if the user information endpoint of the external OIDC identity provider should be signed and verified.

revocationEndpoint.description: The revocation endpoint for the external OIDC identity provider.

roleMapping.description: The association between a specified claim returned from the external OIDC identity provider and an IDaaS role. This mapping is used to associated an IDaaS role when a user is created or modified based on an external OIDC identity provider user authentication or when it is modified based on an external OIDC identity provider user verification. This value can only be set if createUser, updateUser, or updateVerificationUser is true.

scopes.description: The space separated list of scopes to request as part of the external OIDC identity provider user authentication or user verification request. This value is required when creating an IDP except for TWITTER.

tokenEndpoint.description: The token endpoint for the external OIDC identity provider. This value is required when creating an IDP.

type.description: The type of the external OIDC identity provider. Once created, this value cannot be updated. This value is required when creating an IDP.

updateUser.description: A flag indicating if the user should be updated after authenticating to the external OIDC identity provider if it exists. The user attributes specified by the userAttributeMappings attribute are used to populate the user in IDaaS. This value can only be set if authenticationEnabled is true.

updateUserVerification.description: A flag indicating if the user should be updated after user verification to the external OIDC identity provider if it exists. The user attributes specified by the userAttributeMappings attribute are used to populate the user in IDaaS. This value can only be set if verificationEnabled is true.

userAttributeId.description: The IDaaS user attribute ID used to find IDaaS users associated with an external OIDC identity provider user authentication. This value can only be set if authenticationEnabled is true.

userAttributeMappings.description: The association between the claims returned from the external OIDC identity provider and IDaaS user attributes. These attributes are used to populate user attributes when it is created or modified based on an external OIDC identity provider user authentication or when it is modified based on an external OIDC identity provider user verification. If configured, the full set of mappings must be configured. This value can only be set if createUser, updateUser, or updateVerificationUser is true.

userAuthMatchMappings.description: The association between the claims returned from the external OIDC identity provider and IDaaS user attributes. These attributes are used to match an existing IDaaS user based on an external OIDC identity provider user authentication. If configured, the full set of mappings must be configured. This value can only be set if authenticationEnabled is true.

userClaim.description: The external OIDC identity provider claim used to find IDaaS users associated with an external OIDC identity provider user authentication. This value can only be set if authenticationEnabled is true.

userVerMatchMappings.description: The association between the claims returned from the external OIDC identity provider and IDaaS user attributes. These attributes are used to match an existing IDaaS user based on an external OIDC identity provider user verification. If configured, the full set of mappings must be configured. This value can only be set if verificationEnabled is true.

userinfoClaims.description: The space separated list of user information claims to request as part of the external OIDC identity provider user authentication or user verification request.

userinfoEndpoint.description: The user information endpoint for the external OIDC identity provider.

verificationEnabled.description: A flag indicating if the external OIDC identity provider can be used for user verification. If enabled, userVerMatchMappings is required.

OidcIdentityProviderParms.description: An OidcIdentityProviderParms defines the information passed to Identity as a Service when creating or modifying an external OpenID Connect identity provider for use with user authentication or user verification.

claim.description: The name of the claim being mapped. This value must be provided when creating or modifying a user authentication match mapping.

id.description: The UUID of the OIDC identity provider user authentication match mapping.

oidcIdentityProviderId.description: The UUID of the OIDC identity provider the user authentication match mapping belongs to.

userAttributeId.description: The UUID of the IDaaS user attribute being mapped to. This value must be provided when creating or modifying a user authentication match mapping.

OidcIdentityProviderUserAuthMatchMapping.description: An OidcIdentityProviderUserAuthMatchMapping maps a claim returned from an external OIDC identity provide user authentication to an IDaaS User user attribute for matching purposes.

claim.description: The name of the claim being mapped. This value must be provided when creating or modifying a user verification match mapping.

id.description: The UUID of the OIDC identity provider user verification match mapping.

oidcIdentityProviderId.description: The UUID of the OIDC identity provider the user verification match mapping belongs to.

userAttributeId.description: The UUID of the IDaaS user attribute being mapped to. This value must be provided when creating or modifying a user verification match mapping.

OidcIdentityProviderUserVerMatchMapping.description: An OidcIdentityProviderUserVerMatchMapping maps a claim returned from an external OIDC identity provide user verification to an IDaaS User user attribute for matching purposes.

ascending.description: Identifies whether to order results in ascending order.

name.description: Identifies the attribute.

OrderByAttribute.description: An attribute used to sort the result from a search.

displayName.description: The display name of the organization.

id.description: The unique UUID assigned to the organization when it is created.

logoUri.description: The URI of the logo to display when showing organizations.

name.description: The name of the organization.

Organization.description: Organization defines the attributes of an organization used in B2B scenarios.

results.description: A single page from the list of Organizations found.

OrganizationPage.description: Contains paging information and a page of organizations.

displayName.description: The display name of the organization. This value must be provided when creating an organization.

logoUri.description: The URI of the logo to display when showing organizations.

name.description: The name of the organization. This value must be provided when creating an organization.

nextCursor.description: The cursor pointing to the next page.

prevCursor.description: The cursor pointing to the previous page.

allowIgnoreIpAddressForRba.description: Flag indicates if ignore ip address for rba will be allowed or not.

authenticators.description: The list of second factor authenticator types that can be used during a password reset operation.

items.description: The list of second factor authenticator types that can be used during a password reset operation.

challengeSize.description: For a KBA authenticator, it is the number of questions that the user must answer--not supported if these settings are part of a Group Policy (not the Global Policy).

emailAccount.description: Indicates whether an email should be sent to notify the user account has been locked, unlocked, or an attempt of unlock has occurred.

emailOtpEnabled.description: Indicates if OTP can be sent to email.

enabled.description: Indicates whether password reset is enabled.

groups.description: Groups that can perform a password reset operation--not supported if these settings are part of a Group Policy (not the Global Policy).

twoSecondFactorRequired.description: Indicates whether two forms of second factor authentication must be completed before a password reset operation can be done.

unlockAccount.description: Indicates whether the user account should be unlocked after a password reset operation is completed.

version.description: Indicates the version of this model.

wrongAnswersAllowed.description: For a KBA authenticator, it is the number of questions that the user could answer incorrectly and still be considered a valid response--not supported if these settings are part of a Group Policy (not the Global Policy).

PasswordResetSettings.description: Settings used to manage the Password Reset functionality.

addOn.description: Add on column to store PayToPrint addon

consumed.description: The entitlements consumed since start date during the entitlement period.

endDate.description: The date when the entitlement will end.

quantity.description: The number of PayToPrint prints allowed during the period.

startDate.description: The date when the entitlement starts.

actionType.description: The action to which this permission applies.

entityType.description: The entity to which this permission applies.

id.description: The UUID of this permission.

roleType.description: The role type to which this permission applies.

Permission.description: Details about a permission assign to a role.

consumed.description: The entitlements consumed since start date during the entitlement period.

endDate.description: The date when the entitlement will end.

quantity.description: The number of FlashPass claims allowed during the period.

startDate.description: The date when the entitlement starts.

PrinterParms.description: Parameters passed when setting the Printer entitlements of a tenant.

protectedOfflineOTPMaxClients.description: Maximum number of IntelliTrust Desktops (or clients in general) that are allowed to be registered with a token for downloading OTPs.

protectedOfflineOTPMaxRefill.description: Maximum number of hours' worth of offline OTPs that a client is allowed to possess.

protectedOfflineOTPMinorRefill.description: Default number of hours' worth of offline OTPs that is returned.

protectedOfflineOTPProtection.description: This controls the length of the private salt and is measured in bits. The values map as follows: Normal = 14, Strong = 17, and Very Strong = 20

protectedOfflineOTPSupport.description: Defines whether tokens can be used offline.

ProtectedOfflineSettings.description: Offline token settings to support offline token feature for IntelliTrust Desktop applications.

response.description: An optional token response used to reset the token.

ResetParms.description: Parameters needed to reset the token.

apiVersion.description: The resource rules API version used to create or last update this resource rule. If the resource rule is at version 2, then it cannot be updated using a version 1 API.

description.description: The description of the resource rule.

disableSSO.description: A flag indicating if single-sign on is disabled for this resource rule.

enabled.description: A flag indicating if this resource rule is enabled or not.  Only enabled resource rules are considered during authentication.

groups.description: The groups associated with this resource rule. The resource rule only applies to users in one of the specified groups. A resource rule must specify at least one group which can be the default All Groups if you want the resource rule to apply to all users.

highRiskEnableSmartLogin.description: A flag indicating if Smart Login is enabled for High risk. This parameter is deprecated, use the highRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

highRiskFirstStep.description: The authenticator type to use in the first step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is High. This parameter is deprecated, use the highRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

highRiskSecondStep.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is High. This parameter is deprecated, use the highRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

items.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is High. This parameter is deprecated, use the highRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

id.description: The unique UUID assigned to the resource rule when it is created.

lowRiskEnableSmartLogin.description: A flag indicating if Smart Login is enabled for Low risk. This parameter is deprecated, use the lowRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

lowRiskFirstStep.description: The authenticator type to use in the first step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Low. This parameter is deprecated, use the lowRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

lowRiskSecondStep.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Low. This parameter is deprecated, use the lowRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

items.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Low. This parameter is deprecated, use the lowRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

lowRiskThreshold.description: Risk scores below this value are considered Low risk.

mediumRiskEnableSmartLogin.description: A flag indicating if Smart Login is enabled for Medium risk. This parameter is deprecated, use the mediumRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

mediumRiskFirstStep.description: The authenticator type to use in the first step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Medium. This parameter is deprecated, use the mediumRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

mediumRiskSecondStep.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Medium. This parameter is deprecated, use the mediumRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

items.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Medium. This parameter is deprecated, use the mediumRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

mediumRiskThreshold.description: Risk scores below this value are considered Medium risk. Risk scores equal or greater than this value are considered High risk.

name.description: The name of the resource rule.

resourceId.description: The UUID of the resource to which this resource rule is assigned.

resourceName.description: The name of the resource to which this resource rule is assigned.

riskEngineContexts.description: If risk engine rules are defined, the transaction contexts specify the levels at which risk is applied to the authentication request if the corresponding risk engine rules trigger risk.

skipSecondFactorIfUserNotExist.description: A flag indicating if second factor can be skipped if the user does not exist and the first factor is EXTERNAL.

strictAccess.description: A flag indicating if this resource rule enforces strict access. Strict access means that if this rule denies access, the user is denied access even if other resource rules allow access.

systemResourceContext.description: A flag indicating if this resource rule is associated with a system resource including the Admin and User portals. A resource rule for a system resource cannot be deleted.  They can only be disabled if there is at least one enabled resource rule for the resource.

transactionContexts.description: If transaction details are specified during an authentication request, the transaction contexts specify the levels at which risk is applied to the authentication request if the corresponding transaction rules trigger risk. A maximum of two are allowed.

ResourceRule.description: A ResourceRule defines the information returned about a resource rule. A resource rule is used to determine what authentication is used to authenticate to the specified resource (aka application).

id.description: The unique UUID assigned to the resource rule when it is created.

name.description: The name of the resource rule.

ResourceRuleNameId.description: A ResourceRuleNameId contains a resource rule name and unique id.

description.description: The description of the resource rule.

disableSSO.description: A flag indicating if single-sign on is disabled for this resource rule.

enabled.description: A flag indicating if this resource rule is enabled or not.  Only enabled resource rules are considered during authentication.

groupIds.description: The UUIDs of groups associated with this resource rule. The resource rule will only apply to users in one of the specified groups. When creating a resource rule, if no groupsIds are specified, the resource rule will apply to all users.

items.description: The UUIDs of groups associated with this resource rule. The resource rule will only apply to users in one of the specified groups. When creating a resource rule, if no groupsIds are specified, the resource rule will apply to all users.

groups.description: The groups associated with this resource rule. The resource rule only applies to users in one of the specified groups. If no groups are specified, the resource rule applies to all users.  This attribute is ignored if the groupIds attribute is specified. The groupIds attribute should be used instead.

highRiskAuthenticationFlow.description: The UUID of the authentication flow to use when the risk score is High. Required with v2 APIs.

highRiskEnableSmartLogin.description: A flag indicating if Smart Login is enabled for High risk.This parameter is deprecated, use the highRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

highRiskFirstStep.description: The authenticator type to use in the first step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is High. Only the values NONE, EXTERNAL, PASSWORD or DENY should be used for highRiskFirstStep. Other values are defined for backwards compatibility. Some values are not supported by all application types.This parameter is deprecated, use the highRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

highRiskSecondStep.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is High. Some values are not supported by all application types.This parameter is deprecated, use the highRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

items.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is High. Some values are not supported by all application types.This parameter is deprecated, use the highRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

lowRiskAuthenticationFlow.description: The UUID of the authentication flow to use when the risk score is Low. Required with v2 APIs.

lowRiskEnableSmartLogin.description: A flag indicating if Smart Login is enabled for Low risk.This parameter is deprecated, use the lowRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

lowRiskFirstStep.description: The authenticator type to use in the first step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Low.  Only the values NONE, EXTERNAL, PASSWORD should be used for lowRiskFirstStep.  The value DENY can only be specified for low risk authentication when using Smart Login, otherwise DENY can only be specified for medium or high risk values. Other values are defined for backwards compatibility. Some values are not supported by all application types. This parameter is deprecated, use the lowRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

lowRiskSecondStep.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Low. Some values are not supported by all application types. This parameter is deprecated, use the lowRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

items.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Low. Some values are not supported by all application types. This parameter is deprecated, use the lowRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

lowRiskThreshold.description: Risk scores below this value are considered Low risk.

mediumRiskAuthenticationFlow.description: The UUID of the authentication flow to use when the risk score is Medium. Required with v2 APIs.

mediumRiskEnableSmartLogin.description: A flag indicating if Smart Login is enabled for Medium risk.This parameter is deprecated, use the mediumRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

mediumRiskFirstStep.description: The authenticator type to use in the first step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Medium. Only the values NONE, EXTERNAL, PASSWORD or DENY should be used for mediumRiskFirstStep. Other values are defined for backwards compatibility.  Some values are not supported by all application types. This parameter is deprecated, use the mediumRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

mediumRiskSecondStep.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Medium. Some values are not supported by all application types.This parameter is deprecated, use the mediumRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

items.description: The authenticator type to use during in the second step of a two-step authentication scenario when the risk score is Medium. Some values are not supported by all application types.This parameter is deprecated, use the mediumRiskAuthenticationFlow attribute with v2 APIs.

mediumRiskThreshold.description: Risk scores below this value are considered Medium risk. Risk scores equal or greater than this value are considered High risk.

name.description: The name of the resource rule.

removeDateTimeContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeDateTimeContext is set to true, the existing date time context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule.

removeDeviceCertificateContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeDeviceCertificateContext is set to true, the existing device certificate context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule.

removeIPContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeIPContext is set to true, the existing IP context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule.

removeKBAContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeKBAContext is set to true, the existing KBA context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule.

removeLocationContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeLocationContext is set to true, the existing location context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule.

removeLocationHistoryContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeLocationHistoryContext is set to true, the existing location history context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule.

removeMachineContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeMachineContext is set to true, the existing machine context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule.

removeTravelVelocityContext.description: When updating a resource rule, if removeTravelVelocityContext is set to true, the existing travel velocity context is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating a resource rule.

resourceId.description: The UUID of the resource to which this resource rule is assigned. This value is only used when creating a resource rule.

riskEngineContexts.description: If risk engine rules are defined, the transaction contexts specify the level at which risk is applied to the authentication request if the corresponding risk engine rules trigger risk. If set to null, no changes are made. If set to an empty set, transaction contexts are removed.

skipSecondFactorIfUserNotExist.description: A flag indicating if second factor will be skipped if user doesn't exist when the first factor was EXTERNAL.

strictAccess.description: A flag indicating if this resource rule enforces strict access. Strict access means that if this rule denies access, the user is denied access even if other resource rules allow access.

transactionContexts.description: If transaction details are specified during an authentication request, the transaction contexts specify the level at which risk is applied to the authentication request if the corresponding transaction rules trigger risk. A maximum of two are allowed. If set to null, no changes are made. If set to an empty set, transaction contexts are removed.

ResourceRuleParms.description: Parameters defining the new resource rule including the resource to which it applies.

allRoles.description: A flag indicating if administrators with this role can manage all roles and all users.

defaultRole.description: A flag indicating if this role is one of the default roles.

groupIds.description: The UUIDs of groups associated with this role when Group Management is DEFINED. This attribute is ignored if Group Management is ALL or OWN.

items.description: The UUIDs of groups associated with this role when Group Management is DEFINED. This attribute is ignored if Group Management is ALL or OWN.

groupManagement.description: The type of the group management. Defaults to ALL if not provided.

id.description: The UUID of the role.

managedRoles.description: If allRoles is false, this attribute lists the roles and administrators in these roles that can be administered by administrators with this role.  Administrators will also be able to manage end users.

name.description: The name of the role.

permissions.description: A list of the permissions assigned to this role.

superAdministrator.description: A flag indicating if this role is a super administrator.

defaultRole.description: A flag indicating if this role is one of the default roles.

id.description: The UUID of the role.

usersInRole.description: The number of users in this role.

RoleUser.description: The role information returned from a list role operation.

lifetime.description: The lifetime of smart credentials created for this SC Defn.

name.description: The name of this SC Defn.

pivAppletConfigId.description: The UUID of the PIV applet configuration associated with this smart credential definition.

pivContentSignerCAId.description: The UUID of the CA that defines the PIV Content Signer for this SC definition. If not set, the PIV Content Signer is derived from the digital id configs.

defaultValue.description: The default value of this variable.

displayable.description: A flag indicating if values for this variable should be displayed.

generate.description: A flag indicating if the initial value for this variable should be generated.

generateLength.description: A length value used when generating values for this variable.

id.description: The UUID of this SC Defn Variable.

modifiable.description: A flag indicating if values for this variable can be modified.

name.description: The name of this SC Defn Variable.

order.description: A value that specifies the order of this variable with respect to the other variables in the SC Defn.

restrictionDigits.description: A value specifying restrictions on digits appearing in values of this variable.

type.description: The type of this variable.

uniqueness.description: A flag indicating if values of this variable must be unique and if so within what scope.

uniquenessScopeId.description: A value that allows a variable to be defined unique in the scope of another variable.

SCDefnVariable.description: SC Defn Variables define the details about variables defined in the SC Defn.

scDefnVariableId.description: The UUID of the SC Defn Variable that defines the variable.

SCVariableValue.description: SCVariableValues store variable values for a smart credential.

acrValues.description: The space separated list of authentication context request values to request as part of the external SAML identity provider user authentication or user verification request.

acsUrl.description: The assertion consumer service URL provided to the external SAML identity provider. Leave empty to use default value.

authenticationEnabled.description: A flag indicating if the external SAML identity provider can be used for user authentication.

buttonImage.description: The URI of the logo to display on the login button for this external SAML identity provider.

buttonText.description: The unique text to display on the login button for this external SAML identity provider.

createUser.description: A flag indicating if the user should be created after authenticating to the external SAML identity provider if it doesn't exist. The user attributes specified by the userAttributeMappings attribute are used to populate the user in IDaaS. This value is used if authenticationEnabled is true.

domains.description: The space separated list of domains associated with the external SAML identity provider for use with user authentication.

forceAuthn.description: A flag indicating if a force authentication should always be requested as part of the external SAML identity provider user authentication or user verification request.

groupIds.description: The UUIDs of groups that will be assigned to users created after an external SAML identity provider user authentication. An empty list means the user will be assigned to All Groups. If configured, the full set of groups must be configured. This value is used if createUser is true.

groupMapping.description: The association between a specified claim returned from the external SAML identity provider and IDaaS groups. This value is used if createUser, updateUser, or updateVerificationUser is true.

updateUserVerification.description: A flag indicating if the user should be updated after user verification to the external SAML identity provider if it exists. userAttributeMappings.description: The association between the claims returned from the external SAML identity provider and IDaaS user attributes. If configured, the full set of mappings must be configured. This value is used if createUser, updateUser, or updateVerificationUser is true.

userAuthMatchMappings.description: The association between the claims returned from the external SAML identity provider and IDaaS user attributes. These attributes are used to match an existing IDaaS user based on an external SAML identity provider user authentication. If configured, the full set of mappings must be configured. This value is used if authenticationEnabled is true.

userVerMatchMappings.description: The association between the claims returned from the external SAML identity provider and IDaaS user attributes. authenticationAccount.description: When creating a new tenant as a child of the root service provider set this to true if the tenant is to be an authentication service. If not specified, it defaults to true. You cannot set the authenticate and issuance values to both true or both false. A child of a non-root service provider inherits the value of its service provider and if specified, this value is ignored.

companyCountry.description: The country two-letter code (ISO 3166-1) of the location of the company that will own this account.

companyName.description: The name of the company that will own this account.  This value is required.

companyState.description: The province/state two-letter code (postal abbreviation) of the location of the company that will own this account. This value is required for companies in the United States or Canada when the companyCountry attribute is provided.

domain.description: The domain for this account. This value is required when creating a tenant

issuanceAccount.description: When creating a new tenant as a child of the root service provider set this to true if the tenant is to be an issuance service. If not specified, it defaults to false. You cannot set the authenticate and issuance values to both true or both false. A child of a non-root service provider inherits the value of its service provider and if specified, this value is ignored.

serviceProvider.description: When creating a new tenant set this to true if the tenant is to be a service provider.

results.description: A single page with the list of tenants found.

items.description: Actions that can be performed on this token.

items.description: The UUIDs of groups to which this token belongs.  This value is only used for unassigned tokens. Only groups to which the current administrator has access will be returned.

id.description: The unique UUID assigned to the token when it is created.

identityVerificationStatus.description: The identity verification status of the token.

label.description: Optional label to identify an assigned token: a String up to 100 characters.

supportsSignature.description: A flag indicating if the Token supports signature processing.

userId.description: If the token is assigned to a user, this value specifies that user's user id.

results.description: A single page with the list of assigned tokens found.

TransactionContext.description: The transaction context specifies transaction rules. Risk is applied to the authentication 1if the accumulated risk score of the transaction rules is above the risk limit.

items.description: The transaction detail usage. If not provided, the attribute supports all usages. RBA indicates that the detail is used for risk-based authentication; TVS indicates that the detail is used for transaction verification.

TransactionDetail.description: Transaction detail item and its value used with push authenticators and with offline transaction verification.

description.description: The description of this transaction rule.

id.description: The UUID of this transaction rule.

name.description: The name of this transaction rule.

TransactionRuleDescription.description: Information stored for a transaction rule description.

riskScore.description: The risk score that applies if this transaction rule is triggered.

transactionRuleId.description: The id of the transaction rule associated with this risk definition.

TransactionRuleRisk.description: Information associated with the risk of a specific transaction rule within a transaction context.

denyAccess.description: If true, the resource rule evaluating the context will return Access Denied.

riskPoint.description: The number of risk points that apply if this context applies.

TravelVelocityContext.description: Travel velocity checks to see if the time between authentications at different locations means the user has traveled faster than a given velocity. If the velocity is exceeded, risk applies.

unlockChallenge.description: The unlock challenge generated by the token when it is locked.

UnlockParms.description: Parameters specifying parameters for the token unlock operation.

unlockCode.description: The unlock code generated by the service in response to the unlock challenge. This value should be entered into the token to complete the unlock.

UnlockResult.description: The response returned from a token unlock operation.

id.description: The id of the user to be unsynchronized.  The type of the id is specified by idType.

idType.description: The type of the id identifying the user.  The value can be one of UUID (the user's internal UUID) or USERID (the user's userId). The value of EXTERNALID  is currently not supported.  If not specified, this defaults to USERID.

id.description: The id of the user to be updated.  The type of the id is specified by idType.

idType.description: The type of the id identifying the user.  The value can be one of UUID (the user's internal UUID), USERID (the user's userId) or EXTERNALID (the externalId of the user). If not specified, this defaults to UUID.

UpdateUserParms.description: When updating multiple users in a single request, the UpdateUserParms value contains the update parameters for a single user.  It will include the id of the user to be updated and the parameters to be changed for that user.

success.description: Indicates if the user was successfully updated (true) or not (false).

UpdateUserResult.description: When updating multiple users in a single request, the UpdateUserResult value contains the result for a single user.  It will indicate if the operation succeeded and if it failed will include error information describing why the  operation failed.

stopOnError.description: If set to true, the operation stops on the first operation that fails.  Otherwise the operation continues for each specified user. If not specified, this defaults to false.

users.description: The list of users to be updated.

UpdateUsersParms.description: The list of users to update and the parameters to change for each user.

count.description: The entitlements used in the aggregation period.

endTime.description: The end time of the aggregation period.

id.description: The unique UUID for this usage info.

startTime.description: The start time of the aggregation period.

tenantId.description: The unique UUID of the tenant.

trial.description: Whether the usage is associated to a trial tenant.

UsageInfo.description: Entitlement usage information of a tenant.

results.description: A single page with the list of usage info found.

UsageInfoPage.description: Contains paging information and the results from a tenant usage info search.

alternateEmails.description: A list of all the users alternate emails.

authenticatorLockoutStatus.description: A list of all authenticators that the user has with their lockout status.

directoryDN.description: The DN of the user in the directory the user was synchronized from.

directoryId.description: If the user was synchronized from a directory, the UUID of that directory.

directoryName.description: If the user was synchronized from a directory, the name of that directory.

directoryObjectGUID.description: The objectGUID of the user in the directory the user was synchronized from.

directoryType.description: The type of the directory user was synchronized from.

email.description: The email address of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration. It must be set to use EMAIL OTP authentication and other features that require an email address.

externalId.description: An optional external ID for this user.  This value can be used to track the external identity of an Identity as a Service user.

externalSource.description: An optional value that describes the source when the user is synchronized from an external source.

fidoTokens.description: A list of all the FIDO tokens owned by this user.

firstName.description: The first name of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.

frozen.description: Indicates whether a user is unable to authenticate due to inactivity.

frozenGracePeriod.description: Indicates a user's frozen grace period.

grids.description: A list of all the grids owned by this user.

groups.description: A list of all groups to which this user belongs.

id.description: The unique UUID for this user.  This value is generated by the service when a user is created.

lastAuthTime.description: The last time this user successfully authenticated.  Null if the user has never authenticated.

lastModified.description: When the user was last modified.

lastName.description: The last name of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.

locale.description: The locale of this user.  If not set, the default account locale will be used.

locked.description: A flag indicating if this user is locked.

lockedAuthenticatorTypes.description: The user authenticators that are locked.

items.description: The user authenticators that are locked.

lockedAuthenticators.description: The user authenticators that are locked. Deprecated: use lockedAuthenticatorTypes

items.description: The user authenticators that are locked. Deprecated: use lockedAuthenticatorTypes

lockoutExpiry.description: If the user is locked, this value will specify the time at which the lockout will expire.

magicLinkEnabled.description: Indicates whether Magic Links are enabled for this user.

migrated.description: A flag indicating if this user was migrated from Entrust IdentityGuard.

mobile.description: The mobile number of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration. It must be set to use SMS OTP authentication.

oauthRoles.description: A list of all oauth roles to which this user belongs.

organizations.description: A list of the user organizations.

otpCreateTime.description: If the user has an OTP, this attribute specifies when the user's OTP was created.

phone.description: The phone number of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration. It must be set to use VOICE OTP authentication.

preferredOtpDelivery.description: Preferred OTP delivery type (SMS, EMAIL or VOICE) or SYSTEM to use the system defined default.

additionalProperties.description: Preferred OTP delivery contact attribute for the given type (i.e., OTP_EMAIL, OTP_SMS, OTP_VOICE. An empty string means no override for that type).

preferredOtpDeliveryContactAttributes.description: Preferred OTP delivery contact attribute for the given type (i.e., OTP_EMAIL, OTP_SMS, OTP_VOICE. An empty string means no override for that type).

registrationEnabled.description: Indicates whether registration is enabled for this user.

registrationRequired.description: Indicates whether self-registration is required. This attribute doesn't apply to administrators.

securityId.description: The security ID of this user. The security ID is a unique value used to identity the user when performing smart card login to Microsoft Windows.

showNotification.description: Indicates whether to show notifications to this user.

smartCredentials.description: A list of all the smart credentials owned by this user.

state.description: The state of this user.  Only users in the ACTIVE state can perform authentication.

tokens.description: A list of all the tokens owned by this user.

type.description: The type of user.  A value of LDAP_AD means the user was synchronized from a directory. A value of MGMT_UI means the user was created in Identity as a Service. A value of EXTERNAL means the user was synchronized from an external source.

userAliases.description: A list of user aliases for this user.

userAttributeValues.description: A list of user attribute values for this user.

userCreationTime.description: The time this user was created.

userExtraAttributes.description: A list of extra optional attributes for this user.

userId.description: The user ID for this user.

userPrincipalName.description: The user principal name of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.

verificationEnabled.description: Indicates whether verification is enabled for this user.

verificationRequired.description: Indicates whether verification is required. This attribute doesn't apply to administrators.

User.description: The values stored for a user.  This structure is passed when creating or modifying a user.  It is returned when querying a user.

id.description: The UUID of this user alias set when the user alias is created.

type.description: The type of user alias. A value of USERID is used for an alias that will represent the actual user id value. A value of CUSTOM is used for aliases manually created by an administrator.  A value of DERIVED is defined for future use and should not be used at this time.

userId.description: The UUID of the user to which this user alias belongs.

value.description: The value for the user alias.

UserAlias.description: Specifies an alias for a particular user.

name.description: Name of the email attribute.

UserAlternateEmails.description: Specifies alternate emails for a particular user.

id.description: The UUID for this user attribute.  Generated when the user attribute is created.

mandatory.description: A flag indicating if users must have a value for this user attribute.

name.description: The name of this user attribute.

systemDefined.description: A flag indicating if this user attribute is one of the system defined user attributes.

type.description: Type of user attribute. Currently only used to specify the type of contact if the attribute is to be used for OTP delivery.

unique.description: A flag indicating if this attribute is intended to be unique.

mandatory.description: A flag indicating if users must have a value for this user attribute. If not specified when creating a user attribute if defaults to false.

name.description: The name of this user attribute. This must be specified when creating a user attribute.

type.description: Type of user attribute.

unique.description: A flag indicating if this attribute is intended to be unique. If not specified when creating a user attribute it defaults to false.

UserAttributeParms.description: The parameters for the new user attribute.

editable.description: A flag indicating if this user attribute value can be modified.

id.description: The UUID of this user attribute value set when the user attribute value is created.

lastUpdate.description: The last time the attribute value was updated.

userAttributeId.description: The UUID of the user attribute that defines this user attribute value.  The userAttributeId must be provided when creating or modifying a user attribute value.

userId.description: The UUID of the user to which this user attribute value belongs.

value.description: The value for the user attribute.

UserAttributeValue.description: Specifies the value of a user attribute for a particular user.

lockoutDate.description: The date the user was locked. Null means the user is not locked.

lockoutExpiryDate.description: if remainingAuthenticationAttempts is 0 then a lockoutExpiryDate of null means the lockout never expires. Otherwise a value of null means the user isn't locked out.

remainingAuthenticationAttempts.description: The number of authentication attempts remaining before the user is locked out.

type.description: The type of the authenticator.

UserAuthenticatorLockoutStatus.description: Detailed lockout information for each authenticator for a particular user.

state.description: The new state of the user.

UserChangeStateParms.description: User parameters including the new state of the user.

allotment.description: The number of entitlements allotted to the current account.  If the account is an SP then entitlements can be allocated to child accounts. For subscriber accounts, the allotment is always the same as the quantity amount.

consumed.description: The used quantity of this entitlement.

endDate.description: The date when the entitlement ends.

quantity.description: The quantity of entitlements purchased for the account.

startDate.description: The date when the entitlement starts.

expectedLocations.description: The list of expected locations stored for this user.

maximumExpectedLocations.description: The maximum number of expected locations that can be stored for this user.

UserExpectedLocations.description: Information about the expected locations stored for a user.

id.description: The UUID of this extra user attribute.

name.description: The name for the extra user attribute.

type.description: Type of custom user attribute.

value.description: The value for the extra user attribute.

UserExtraAttribute.description: Specifies an extra optional attribute for a particular user.

lifetime.description: The lifetime of the authenticator in days.

UserFaceSettings.description: User settings for the Face Biometric authenticator.

userId.description: If fetching a user by userId or alias, this value specifies, the userId or user alias of the user to be fetched. If fetching a user by externalId, this value specifies, the externalId of the user to be fetched.

UserGetParms.description: The user Id or user alias of the user to be fetched.

city.description: The city name--always returned in upper-case.

expiryDate.description: The date this user location will expire.

id.description: The UUID of the user location.

isp.description: The ISP name--always returned in upper-case.

lastAuthenticationTime.description: The time of the last authentication from this location.

numberOfAuthentications.description: The number of times this location was used during authentication.

privateIpAddress.description: Whether the IP provided is a private IP Address.

UserLocation.description: Information stored describing a user location.

expiryTime.description: When this machine secret expires in UTC time

id.description: Identifies the device/machine

label.description: Identifies the device/machine from the end-user point of view

lastUsedTime.description: When this machine secret was last used

registrationTime.description: When this machine secret was created in UTC time

organizations.description: A list of organization UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these organizations replace existing organizations.

items.description: A list of organization UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these organizations replace existing organizations.

UserOrganizationParms.description: Parameter with a list of organization UUIDs that will be assigned to the user.

applyGracePeriod.description: Indicates if the user is granted a new frozen grace period. This value is not used when creating a user. If provided, it will be ignored.

email.description: The email address of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  It must be set to use EMAIL OTP authentication and other features that require an email address.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

emailVerification.description: Indicates if a verification email message should be sent to the user if the user now requires verification. The user's policy requiring user verification must also be enabled for the user. If not set, this value defaults to true.

externalId.description: An optional external ID for this user.  This value can be used to track the external identity of an Identity as a Service user. To unset the external ID, specify an empty string.

externalSource.description: An optional value that describes the source when the user is synchronized from an external source. To unset the external source, specify an empty string.

firstName.description: The first name of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

groups.description: A list of group UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these groups replace existing groups.

items.description: A list of group UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these groups replace existing groups.

lastName.description: The last name of this user.    This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

locale.description: The locale of this user.  If not set, the default account locale will be used. To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

lock.description: Indicates if all the user's authenticators are locked or not.

mobile.description: The mobile number of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  It must be set to use SMS OTP authentication.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

oauthRoles.description: A list of oauth role UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these oauth roles replace existing oauth roles.

items.description: A list of oauth role UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these oauth roles replace existing oauth roles.

organizations.description: A list of organization UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these organizations replace existing organizations.

items.description: A list of organization UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these organizations replace existing organizations.

phone.description: The phone number of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  It must be set to use VOICE OTP authentication.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

preferredOtpDelivery.description: Preferred OTP delivery type (SMS, EMAIL or VOICE) or SYSTEM to use the system defined default.

additionalProperties.description: Preferred OTP delivery contact attribute for the given type (i.e., OTP_EMAIL, OTP_SMS, OTP_VOICE. An empty string means no override for that type).

preferredOtpDeliveryContactAttributes.description: Preferred OTP delivery contact attribute for the given type (i.e., OTP_EMAIL, OTP_SMS, OTP_VOICE. An empty string means no override for that type).

registrationRequired.description: Indicates whether self-registration is required. If not set when the user is created, this value defaults to true.

securityId.description: The security ID of this user. The security ID is a unique value used to identity the user when performing smart card login to Microsoft Windows.

state.description: The state of this user.  Only users in the ACTIVE state can perform authentication. If not set when the user is created, this value defaults to ACTIVE.

userAliases.description: A list of user aliases for this user. Alias values must be unique with respect to the userId and other aliases of this user and other users.

userAttributeValues.description: A list of user attribute values for this user.

userExtraAttributes.description: A list of extra optional attributes for this user.

userId.description: The user ID for this user.  This value is required when creating the user, optional during update. The userId must be unique with respect to aliases of this user and the userId and aliases of all other users.

userPrincipalName.description: The user principal name of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

verificationRequired.description: Indicates whether verification is required. If not set when the user is created, this value defaults to true.

expiryNotificationDate.description: The date at which the next password expiry notification will be sent.

expiryTime.description: The date at which the password will expire.

forceUpdate.description: Indicates if the user will be forced to change their password the next time the user authenticates with it.

lastChangedTime.description: The last time the password was changed.

newPassword.description: The value of the new password generated by IDaaS if requested by the client.

present.description: A flag that indicates if the user has a password.

UserPassword.description: Information returned when a user password is queried.

clearPasswordHistory.description: If set to true, this flag indicates existing password history is cleared before the new password is created.

currentPassword.description: A value for the current password when changing the AD-User password.

emailPassword.description: A flag indicating whether to email a new password to the user.  It defaults to true.

expiryTime.description: The date at which the password will expire.

forceUpdate.description: If set to true, this value indicates the user will be forced to change their password upon next password authentication.

generatePassword.description: A flag indicating whether a new random password is generated. It defaults to false.

password.description: A value for the new password when setting the user password. This value is ignored if generatePassword is set to true.

passwordFormat.description:
Define the password format of new password, it's BCRYPT when importing BCrypted password, it defaults to CLEARTEXT if not provided.When passwordFormat is BCRYPT, the following restrictions must be enforced:
  • 1.the user must be an IDaaS local user.
  • 2.currentPassword must be null.
  • 3.generatePassword must be false.
  • 4.emailPassword must be false.
  • 5.returnPassword must be false.

returnPassword.description: A flag indicating if a password generated by IDaaS should be returned to the caller. This flag is ignored  if the password is passed from the client.  It defaults to false.

UserPasswordParms.description: Parameters specifying how the password is to be modified. This value may include an actual password or arguments specifying that the service should create a random password.

adComplexity.description: A boolean flag indication if adComplexity is enabled.

includeLowercase.description: Specifies if an lowercase character is required, allowed or not allowed in the password.

includeNonalphanumeric.description: Specifies if non-alphanumeric character is required, allowed or not allowed in the password.

includeNumber.description: Specifies if a numeric character is required, allowed or not allowed in the password.

includeUppercase.description: Specifies if an uppercase character is required, allowed or not allowed in the password.

lifetimeDays.description: The lifetime of the password in days.

maximumLength.description: The maximum length of the password.

maximumRepeated.description: Maximum number of repeated characters allowed

minimumLength.description: The minimum length of the password.

minimumLifetime.description: The minimum lifetime of the password restricting how frequently the password can be changed.

minimumStrength.description: Minimum password strength. Password set/update will be rejected, if strength of the password is less than this value. 0: Disabled, 1: Weak protection from throttled online attacks: very guessable, 3: Good protection from offline attacks: safely unguessable, 4: Strong protection from offline attacks: very unguessable

numberOfLowercaseRequired.description: Number of lower case characters required.

numberOfNonalphanumericRequired.description: Required number of non alpha numeric characters required.

numberOfUppercaseRequired.description: Number of upper case characters required.

passwordHistorySize.description: Size of password history for a user.

suggestions.description: Suggestions on how the password strength can be improved.

items.description: Suggestions on how the password strength can be improved.

ignorePasswordHistory.description: If set to true, existing password history is ignored.

password.description: New password value that needs to be validated.

adComplexity.description: True if password meets the active directory complexity requirements.

alias.description: True if password meets the userId requirements. Password must not contain user alias.

alphaNumeric.description: True if password meets the alpha numeric requirements.

blacklisted.description: True if password does not contain a blacklisted password.

directoryType.description: Type of the directory the user is associated with, ON_PREM, AZURE or AD Connector.

fullName.description: True if password meets the full name requirements. Full Name must not be in the password.

length.description: True if password meets the length requirements.

lowerCase.description: True if password meets the lower case requirements.

nondeterministicValidations.description: List of validations that cannot be determined mostly due to user is AD managed.

items.description: List of validations that cannot be determined mostly due to user is AD managed.

numeric.description: True if password meets the numeric requirements.

passwordHistory.description: True if password does not match the history if enabled.

repeatedCharacters.description: True if password meets the repeated characters requirements.

strength.description: True if password meets the minimum strength requirements.

upperCase.description: True if password meets the upper case requirements.

userID.description: True if password meets the userId requirements. Password must not contain userId.

id.description: The UUID of the KBA question/answer.

UserQuestion.description: A KBA question/answer stored for a user.

locationHistoryIpCheckRequired.description: A flag indicating if the IP address is considered when checking to see if two locations are the same.

maximumLocationHistory.description: The maximum number of user locations stored in location history.

velocityCheckRequired.description: A flag indicating if a velocity check is performed when checking the current location against location history.

results.description: A single page with the list of users found.

UsersPage.description: Contains paging information and the results from a user search.

callbackUrl.description: The callback url of the webhook.

enabled.description: A flag indicating if the webhook is enabled.

expired.description: A flag indicating if the webhook has expired.

expiryDate.description: The timestamp of when the webhook is set to expire. If no expiry is set, this value will be NULL.

id.description: The ID of the webhook. This value is generated when the webhook is created.

filter.description: Subset of resource, or group IDs of the webhook event. All resources are selected by default if this parameter is not specified.

id.description: The ID of the webhook event. This value is not needed when creating/updating a webhook.

type.description: The event type set to trigger the webhook.

WebhookEvent.description: Information returned about the events of a webhook.

callbackUrl.description: The client callback url for this webhook.

enabled.description: A flag indicating if the webhook is enabled.

expiry.description: How long to keep the webhook alive for (in days). Value of 0 means no expiration. Once a webhook has reached expiry, it will be marked as disabled. This parameter is optional and is not set by default.

WebhookParms.description: Parameters including the callback URL and list of events to trigger the webhook.

ZoneId.description: The timezone offset in which dates and times are considered. For example, a value like -05:00 to specify EST.  Set the timezone value if you want to allow times 8am to 5pm in the customer's time zone and not the time zone of the service.  If not specified, the default is Z for UTC.
